[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: Handshake storm] [Resource exhaustion] Can attackers initiate thousands of concurrent handshakes to exhaust validator CPU, memory, or file descriptors? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: Slow read attack] [Connection exhaustion] Can attackers send handshake init messages byte-by-byte slowly to hold connections open and exhaust connection pools? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: Invalid handshakes] [CPU exhaustion] Can repeated invalid handshake attempts force expensive cryptographic operations that exhaust validator CPU? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: Timestamp storage] [Memory DoS] Can attackers with many public keys exhaust memory by forcing timestamp storage for each unique key in the HashMap? (High)
[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: Error logging] [Disk DoS] Can repeated authentication failures fill disk with logs, causing validator disk exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [DoS: RwLock contention] [Lock DoS] Can attackers trigger continuous write lock acquisition on anti_replay_timestamps to starve legitimate handshakes? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Crypto: KDF derivation] [Weak keys] Does the Noise protocol implementation use proper KDF for deriving session keys, or can weak derivation lead to predictable keys? (Critical)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Crypto: Nonce handling] [Nonce reuse] Can session nonces be reused across different connections, breaking authenticated encryption guarantees? (Critical)
[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Crypto: MAC verification] [Timing attacks] Is MAC verification constant-time to prevent timing side-channels that leak authentication secrets? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Crypto: Key confirmation] [Missing KCI] Does the protocol protect against Key Compromise Impersonation attacks where compromised long-term keys enable impersonation? (High)
[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Crypto: Protocol version] [Version downgrade] Can attackers force use of older, potentially vulnerable Noise protocol versions? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Validator: Byzantine behavior] [Equivocation] Can a Byzantine validator equivocate by presenting different network_context or peer_id values to different peers? (Critical)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Validator: Consensus disruption] [Connection flooding] Can an attacker flood validators with handshake requests to delay consensus message processing and affect liveness? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Validator: Eclipse attack] [Peer isolation] Can attackers exploit handshake authentication to eclipse specific validators by preventing legitimate peer connections? (Critical)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Validator: Sybil attack] [Identity multiplication] Can attackers create multiple peer identities that all authenticate successfully to amplify their network influence? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Validator: Stake grinding] [Role manipulation] Can validators with staking keys manipulate peer roles during handshake to gain unauthorized privileges? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Integration: PeersAndMetadata] [Stale metadata] Can stale peer metadata cause handshakes to use outdated authentication information, creating security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Integration: NoiseStream] [Stream confusion] After handshake, can NoiseStream sessions be confused or swapped between different authenticated peers? (Critical)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Integration: NetworkContext] [Context switching] Can network context switches during handshake cause authentication to be validated against wrong network policies? (High)

[File: network/framework/src/noise/handshake.rs] [Integration: Error types] [Information leakage] Do NoiseHandshakeError variants leak sensitive information about internal state or network topology? (Medium)
